title: Retail Expansion Project Architect – Europe
content:
Established in 1981 with a single store in the Northwest of England, the JD Group is a leading omni-channel retailer of Sports Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues and over 3,400 stores across several retail fascias in over 30 markets around the world.
JD Sports Fashion Plc was listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1996 and has been a FTSE100 publicly quoted company since 2019 and continues to grow in the UK and internationally.
We want to be the leading global omnichannel retailer in the sports and outdoor industry. To be a part of this successful company and help us to achieve this you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people-led, innovative and customer-focused organisation which provides operational excellence whilst identifying new areas of growth as part of our day to day objectives.
Role Overview:
Managing all stages of the Construction Administration phases to support the extensive New Store, Refurbishment and Acquisition Projects process to strict deadlines whilst reducing fee spend and consolidating costs. This role demands strong negotiation skills along with a high level of Technical Construction understanding to manage external parties and influence change in how we operate our third-party relationships with GC’s and Landlords across Europe. This role involves being at the fore front of every project with the Acquisitions Team. Fully understanding the lease conditions and recognising opportunities to maximise the unit specification to the Groups benefit resulting in a high level of success by creating the strongest unit deliveries alongside the best possible terms at the Stage 1 process. With your strong management skills this role also focuses on locating and managing the very best of In Country specialist knowledge. The Groups desire to work with localspecialist individuals that can really make the difference on a JD project. This will further assist us in setting up the fully extended JD Projects Team to support the Team of In Country JD Project Managers and JD Store Acquisition Managers that work across Europe supporting and managing our expansion plan. in achieving the best Design and solutions on each store. From a cost prohibitive project requiring a low-cost approach to the biggest of Flagship projects requiring a structural solution, our extensive contacts list for each Country is based on setting up additional key third partyroles (Consultants) creating an extended local support team able to deal with every kind of Construction challenge, locally, completely and in local language. We will provide in Country preferred Architects that can support our businesses UK Based Design Team with instant feedback on legislation and legal requirements across Europe achieving sound advice sharing between teams and helping us to speed up the end-to-end project cycle and overall assisting in reducing the project durations so that we deliver greater volumes of stores in Europe year on year. In addition to the European Expansion, the role focuses on Management of External Specialist service resources throughout Western, Southern & Northern Europe including the Development and negotiation of standardisation of Unit Specifications and new store openings, extensions and re fits Primarily in France, Spain, Germany & Italy but the European operation expands to the coverage of 15Countries the role may extend into other regions as required. This role supports our existing European remit to act as a centre of excellence to drive store standards to a market leading level.
Key Duties/Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Group Projects Manager - Europe you will work across various Countries throughout Europe and manage the relationships with General Contractors, Third Party suppliers and Landlords through the end-to-end project cycle for new stores, re-fits, and extensions ensuring the teams meet the highest standards. This includes managing and coordinating the efforts of our.
In Country Project Managers and third-party contractors or consultants to deliver projects to plan.Manage and provide support to the Project Management Team with the MEP Process which will be adopted into more Countries in the future and implemented on a greater scale by this existence of this role.
Working alongside our Internal Team of Project Managers, Quantity Surveys & Acquisition Managers you will be part of a fast moving, professional and successful property expansion team. You will be required to Develop,monitor, control, train and positively promote the Landlords specification document for each project keeping the Team always updated on your allocated projects status and opportunities.
Ensure best practice and health and safety is always adhered too.
Attend and understand most of the Unit Specifications related to European Development especially where new store Project Briefs have been issued and are likely to generate a new store project.
Identify Specialist services opportunities and work with Project Managers in seeking out the best and most cost effective and relevant local expertise ensuring that we have a Core Team available to answer in Country questions as and when required.
Lead and support the wider Project Team delivering progress reports, proposals, requirements, documentation, and presentations where appropriate always promoting a strong support for consistency and department standards.
Strive for excellence in all JD processes within the Projects team, continually reviewing and developing improvements.
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential risks and devise contingency plans as required.
Coach, mentor, motivate and supervise project team members and contractors encouraging them to take positive action and assume accountability for their assigned work.

Skills/Experience/Knowledge needed:

A solid and confident negotiator who can achieve excellent results by driving the business requests and achieving strong results.
Construction/Retail Fit Out experience: You will have sound knowledge, experience, and exposure to European General Contractors, External Architect Consultancies and Specialist Services.
A High level of Technical Construction understanding is essential in this role.
A good understanding of the Legal Contractual process is essential.
Evidence of working throughout Europe on Construction, Fire Safety, Structural, Mechanical & Electrical related projects will be essential.
Clear understanding of the various Permit Applications processes particularly in France, Spain, Germany, and Italy would be advantageous.
Local legislation requirements, Compliancy, Local Process & Timescales understanding for the key European Countries is essential to being able to manage the project cycle effectively.
Bureau de Control requirements & general French legislation processes enabling you to successfully manage retail projects up to €5m.Strong Architectural and Project Management experience with another leading process driven Retailer will be advantageous but not completely essential.
Involvement and a track record in Retail Role Out programmes will naturally benefit this position.
You will be able to manage multiple, simultaneous projects across several group fascia’s keeping them on budget and delivering them on time & to the highest standards with particular focus on Cost Management and developing a strong cost focus on budgets and value engineering.
Excellent communication & influencing skills: You will have the ability to communicate effectively with multiple stakeholders and departments through, face to face and Video Call Presentations.
Numerate and strong attention to detail.
Qualifications: Degree or recognised project management qualification.
This role is field based, and you will need to be geographically mobile to support our vastly expanding store network. Consideration will only be given to those living within one of the current specific Lead Countries and employment contracts will be via the applicable Regional HQ for Tax and Liability purposes.
Self-motivated, with natural Leadership qualities. You will lead a small projects team and need to lead the team by example.
I.T &Technically competent with knowledge of various software programmes.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Can react to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently.
Flexible during times of change.
Extensive travel and periods of time away from home in Country and abroad as required.
Bilingual French, Spanish, German & English, or combination of will be advantageous and any other European languages being advantageous.
Full European Driving Licence essential.
Must hold a Full European Passport allowing cross Boarder traveling throughout Europe.

At JD Group we offer a cooperation and mutual respect based environment, including a solid commitment with diversity and equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered as equal no matter their gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age nor disability status.
In our recruitment processes, we consider your knowledge and skills, as well as your passion to discover, grow and build new ideas.
What do we offer?

Percentage under objectives.
Flexible schedule.
Remote working.
Tax credit (health insurance, restaurant ticket, childcare ticket).
Employee discount.
Development and career plan in an international environment.
Training both in hard skills and soft skills.
Sport facilities in the company headquarters.
Employee Wellness Programs
Corporate Volunteer Programs within the working day.
